text: The Clinton Liberal Institute was a coeducational preparatory school. The Universalist Church started it in Clinton, New York in 1831.Joseph Henry Allen, Richard Eddy, History of Universalism, p. 486-490. The school moved to Fort Plain, New York in 1878, and it stayed there until it was destroyed in a fire in 1900.Clinton Lee Scott, The Universalist Church of America: A Short History (1957), p. 76. Clara Barton, the founder of the American Red Cross, and Leland Stanford, founder of Stanford University went to the Clinton Liberal Institute. == References == == Other websites == * New York Heritage Digital Collection of images from the Clinton Liberal Institute Category:Schools in New York (state) Category:1831 establishments in the United States Category:1900 disestablishments
